bugs.title: CVE-2021-44854 mediawiki: Rest API incorrectly publicly caches results from private wikis [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-44854 mediawiki: Rest API incorrectly publicly caches results from private wikis [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-44854 mediawiki: Rest API incorrectly publicly caches results from private wikis

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.35.5, 1.36.x before 1.36.3, and 1.37.x before 1.37.1. The REST API publicly caches results from private wikis.

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T292763

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2156317]

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-44854

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2156316

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

bugs.title: CVE-2021-44856 mediawiki: Title blocked in AbuseFilter can be created via Special:ChangeContentModel due to the mishandling of EditFilterMergedContent hook return value [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-44856 mediawiki: Title blocked in AbuseFilter can be created via Special:ChangeContentModel due to the mishandling of EditFilterMergedContent hook return value [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-44856 mediawiki: Title blocked in AbuseFilter can be created via Special:ChangeContentModel due to the mishandling of EditFilterMergedContent hook return value

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.35.5, 1.36.x before 1.36.3, and 1.37.x before 1.37.1. A title blocked by AbuseFilter can be created via Special:ChangeContentModel due to the mishandling of the EditFilterMergedContent hook return value.

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41767 mediawiki: reassignEdits doesn't update results in an IP range check on Special:Contributions [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41767 mediawiki: reassignEdits doesn't update results in an IP range check on Special:Contributions [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41767 mediawiki: reassignEdits doesn't update results in an IP range check on Special:Contributions

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.35.8, 1.36.x and 1.37.x before 1.37.5, and 1.38.x before 1.38.3. When changes made by an IP address are reassigned to a user (using reassignEdits.php), the changes will still be attributed to the IP address on Special:Contributions when doing a range lookup.

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T316304

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2156332]

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-41767

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2156331

An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.35.9, 1.36.x through 1.38.x before 1.38.5, and 1.39.x before 1.39.1. When installing with a pre-existing data directory that has weak permissions, the SQLite files are created with file mode 0644, i.e., world readable to local users. These files include credentials data.

https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/mediawiki-announce@lists.wikimedia.org/thread/UEMW64LVEH3BEXCJV43CVS6XPYURKWU3/
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T322637

bugs.title: CVE-2023-22945 mediawiki: GrowthExperiments growthmanagementorlist API allows blocked users to enroll as mentors [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-22945 mediawiki: GrowthExperiments growthmanagementorlist API allows blocked users to enroll as mentors [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-22945 mediawiki: GrowthExperiments growthmanagementorlist API allows blocked users to enroll as mentors

long_desc.thetext:
In the GrowthExperiments extension for MediaWiki through 1.39, the growthmanagementorlist API allows blocked users (blocked in ApiManageMentorList) to enroll as mentors or edit any of their mentorship-related properties.

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T321733
https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/q/Id1b83fcd58eccb8b2dfea44a3ab2f72314860d88

bugs.title: CVE-2023-22911 mediawiki: XSS in widget placement [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-22911 mediawiki: XSS in widget placement [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-22911 MediaWiki: XSS in widget placement

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.35.9, 1.36.x through 1.38.x before 1.38.5, and 1.39.x before 1.39.1. E-Widgets does widget replacement in HTML attributes, which can lead to XSS, because widget authors often do not expect that their widget is executed in an HTML attribute context.

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T149488

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2161180]

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2023-22911

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2161179
